content:
I've edited the puzzle based on the comment in the forum ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-sign-programming-language-puzzle-discussion/206232/2 ):

Goal
* moved NOP before ADD INST COUNT

Output
* changed "Result" to "Final register value"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A straighforward puzzle with lots of test cases.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I love interpreter puzzles.  I did it without regex because I suck at those.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: i think this puzzle is very good for easy mode. Without the ADD INST COUNT instruction i think it would be good for CoC? i think that because i have little difficult understanding the ADD INST COUNT instruction... and almost all code was done but that instruction took me a lot :)

Adapted from https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/96639d99d371145cad0fa68591700eb86eb6c, comments said it was too long/complex for a CoC so submitting it as a puzzle here (7 months after because I was kinda busy).

Cover was made by screenshotting the output of the following thematic program:

```
from random import choice, choices, randint

addp = lambda: "/$" + "".join(choices("$*.", k=randint(1, 5))) + "/"
addn = lambda: "//" + "".join(choices("$*.", k=randint(1, 5))) + "/"
mulp = lambda: "/**" + "".join(choices("$*.", k=randint(1, 5))) + "/"
muln = lambda: "/*/" + "".join(choices("$*.", k=randint(1, 6))) + "/"
addc = lambda: "$"

for f in choices([addp, addn, mulp, muln, addc], [10, 9, 5, 4, 1], k=10000):
    print(f(), end="")

print()
```

For the record (mostly when the rejected contribution will be deleted), the original comments were the following:

<mathferm> The description is clear and the puzzle quite interesting, not easy to code in less than 5min but definitely doable

<aflorido> This is a fantastic puzzle, but I found it impossible to solve in under 15 minutes.

It takes some time to read the statement and the tests, then the implementation's difficulty depends a lot on the language of choice, and debugging when a case fails is not easy because manually reading and understanding a long string with only 3 different symbols takes some time. The characters /*$ being special regex characters only adds to this difficulty.

Great job on the puzzle, I would certainly enjoy this as a standalone puzzle, but it was way too hard for a clash for me. If other users disagree and tell me they solved it in time without checking the author's solution (bonus points if not in python), I will remove the rejection.

<LeMasSon> same reason as Aflorido, I don't think that for the majority of people this is feasible under 5mins.

It would make an excellent puzzle

<Stef_3> I solved it in 5 minutes with two caveats:
- I read the instructions before starting my timer; reading the instructions probably adds at least 3 minutes if not more
- I didn't bother to handle SYNTAX ERROR; handling it properly would easily add another 5 minutes.

I suggest removing SYNTAX ERROR from the description if you want to keep it as a Clash and not as a Puzzle: the time constraint is already hard enough if we can trust the input to be a correct program.

<cppprogrammer> too hard to solve under 5 minutes

(total: 1 approval, 3 rejections)
